alert.note: Alert for Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 8:06PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Williamson and northwestern Travis Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 806 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lago Vista, or 10 miles west of Anderson Mill, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Austin, Cedar Park, Anderson Mill, Leander, Lakeway, Lago Vista, Bee Cave, Hudson Bend, The Hills, Mansfield Dam, Barton Creek, Jonestown, Briarcliff, Point Venture, Volente, Lost Creek, Brushy Creek and Jollyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
